[41]"Snoogans," I believe it was. 
[42]Ohhh. Well, that's too bad. 
[43]They're gonna do it. 
[44]Remember--we meet back here when you're done. You sure you're okay with this? 
[45]Maybe it's because women don't like to be called "bitches," Jay. 
[46]How about not. 
[47]Something sweet, you big goof. Something nice. 
[48]Okay.  That's a start. 
[49]Man you are such a bitch-- 
[50]Jay, you don't have to do this. 
[51]Yes, sir. 
[52]You are so gay. 
[53]We can't just leave them like this! That alarm's gonna bring the cops here any minute! 
[54]
[55]Your tape worked. The news is all about Jay and Silent Bob's Provasik break-in, with almost no mention of the Diamond heist. 
[56]Don't you feel any regret? Jay and Bob don't deserve this. They were really sweet. 
[57]They're your gang. 
[58]We all gotta grow up some time. 
[59]Don't you feel the least bit of guilt for what we did to those guys? 
[60]I'm sorry, Jay. 
[61]Oh my God! Jay! No! 
[62]Fuck it. 
[63]It was just a diversion so we could steal these. 
[64]And they're not the leaders of C.L.I.T. The C.L.I.T. is not real. 
[65]Are you guys alright? 
[66]You remembered. It was a frame-up, Jay. Sissy. Missy, Chrissy, and I are international jewel thieves. We were setting you up as a patsy, but I couldn't go through with it, because I... because I love you. 
[67]I can't do that, Sissy 
[68]What's it gonna be, Sissy? Which fighting style do you want me to kick your ass in? 
[69]You're no match for my "Shaolin Monk." 
[70]A little "Venus's--flytrap"? 
[71]How about a little "Bitch, My Man Ain't Yo Baby's Daddy"? 
[72]Call me Boo-Boo Kitty Fuck--BITCH! 
[73]C'mon guys. It's over. 
[74]No. I'm tired of running. 
[75]You awake, Marshal? Marshal? 
[76]You're not paralyzed. It was just a tranquilizer. 
[77]You have friends in the F.B.I.? 
[78]Maybe not. I can make you a deal that'll get you into the F.B.I., regardless of test scores. 
[79]You drop the charges against Jay and Silent Bob and say you never found the ape.  Make sure the world knows they're not in control of any C.L.I.T. 
[80]I'll explain later, Jay In exchange, I'll give you the diamonds I stole, and turn in Sissy, Missy, Chrissy, and myself. But I want a reduced sentence. 
[81]For him? I'd be willing to do anything. 
[82]I'm an international jewel thief who's facing a jail sentence. 
[83]If I go to prison, will you wait for me? 
[84]Snoogans. 
[85]Wait for me. 
[86]Are these leg cuffs really necessary?
dialogues.WILLENHOLLY:
[1]Yeah, you chug that ass-cock baby-- It takes two hands to hold doesn't it--?  Uhhh-- 
[2]
[3]Have you read this article on the mule-suckers in Tijuana? Good God, I wish that was in our jurisdiction-- I'd shut down every last one of those ass-cock chuggers, personally. 
[4]What? "Ass" means "donkey." 
[5]Boulder, hunh? Well, gas up the jet. 
[6]Then gas up the next best thing. 
[7]My, oh my, oh my. Who let the cats out? Wait--is that right? 
[8]Federal Wildlife Marshal. This investigation is now under my jurisdiction. 
[9]Because someone let a whole mess of animals out of their cages, sir. 
[10]Yeah, right. That's a believable scenario. It sounds more like something out of a bad movie. 
[11]Listen up, ladies and gentlemen! Our fugitive has been on the run for 6 hours!  Average simian foot speed over uneven ground--barring injuries or preoccupation with tire tubes, mites or bananas--is four miles an hour. That gives us a radius of twenty miles. 
[12]What? 
[13]Yes. Yes, you're right. My bad. Twenty- four miles. Now what I want out of all of you is a hard target search. 
[14]Yeah? 
[15]Well. It's--a target--that's--hard. Anyway-- 
[16]Okay, how about this? What I want out of all of you is a thorough search of every gas station, residence, warehouse, farmhouse, henhouse, outhouse, and doghouse in that area! Checkpoints go up at fifteen miles! 
[17]This is so frustrating. It's just so hard sometimes-- 
[18]What is it? 
[19]Is it VHS or Beta? You know what-- never mind. Do you have a VCR? 
[20]Oh my God-- Have the jet gassed up and ready to go at a moment's notice. 
[21]Doesn't anybody have a jet anymore? Plafsky? It is Willenholly. You gotta get me on the national news, pronto. Why?!  Because we may very well be dealing with the two most dangerous men on the planet! 
[22]From the intelligence we've been able to gather, we've discovered that the C.L.I.T. is a tiny offshoot of the L.A.B.I.A. 
[23]Exactly. The men you saw in the video are believed to be the masterminds responsible for the frenzied C.L.I.T. activity last night. They go by the obvious code names "Jay" and "Silent Bob." If you should come across them or any other C.L.I.T.-ies, please-- exercise extreme caution. 
[24]Nonsense. We're all over the C.L.I.T., Reg. 
[25]There's nothing to suggest that, no. But these men are still to be considered very dangerous. 
[26]Yes, Excuse me. Federal Wildlife Marshal. I'm on my way! We got 'em. They're in Utah. Citizens of Utah--steer clear of the C.L.I.T. Stimulation of the C.L.I.T. is not recommended. 
[27]What? 
[28]Look, who's the Federal Wildlife Marshal here? 
[29]
[30]Maybe they're one of those gay couples? 
[31]Oh God, this is the last thing I need--a bunch of uppity homosexuals shooting their mouth off in the liberal press that the Federal Wildlife Marshal's Office persecutes gays. 
[32]You see this badge?  I think I'd recognize an ape if I saw one. And the only thing I do recognize here is a political fiasco I'm, going to avoid by letting this butt-fucking Brady Bunch go! 
[33]
[34]
[35]Yes, sir--or ma'am. Please accept my apologies for detaining you and your unorthodox-but-constitutionally- protected-family unit. 
[36]I'm sure Utah appreciates that. You might also want to make it clear that the Federal Wildlife Marshal's Office is also pro-'mo as well. And might I add, that's one fine- looking boy you're raising. 
[37]He certainly looks insatiable. 
[38]'Bye 
[39]Well, it's not my way--but damned if there doesn't go one happy family. Now, we just shoot some tear gas into that diner, and when the two guys run out with the monkey, we'll-- 
[40]That was the them, wasn't it? 
[41]Fire a warning shot into that bulbous ass! 
[42]Wow! That was an incredibly daring escape! You must see that a lot, hunh? 
[43]Sire, you're very taciturn. 
[44]You and your men stay up here. When I corner them, I'll call you for back-up. 
[45]A Federal Wildlife Marshal doesn't wait for his prey to come to him. He comes to it. Or goes to it. Is it "comes to it" or "goes to it"? I'm going in there. I'm counting on you Sheriff. 
[46]You've taught me so much. 
[47]
[48]
[49]
[50]
[51]Oh, no--think you can pull a Peter Pan on me?! 
[52]
[53]Do you have a microwave here, Sheriff? 
[54]Because I need to dry my gun out so I can SHOOT YOU WITH IT ! TWICE! 
[55]"All you motherfuckers are gonna pay. You are the ones who are ball- lickers.  We're gonna fuck your mothers while you watch and cry like little bitches. Once we get to Hollywood--" They're going to Hollywood. 
[56]Yes, this is Federal Wildlife Marshal Willenholly. Can I speak with Agent Sid Enmarty, please? 
[57]Sid? Hey, buddy. I'm calling because I could really use your help on this killer case I'm working. 
[58]No, no--nothing like that. Say--there aren't other people listening in, are there? 
[59]Good. I'm tracking a monkey down that's on it's way to Los Angeles, and I could use some bureau backup. 
[60]Am, uh--Am I on speaker phone? 
[61]Alright, now that's not fair. I know I didn't make it as high up as you guys, but my job's just as important. 
[62]I come to you as a friend--as a fellow professional--and this is the shit I get?! 
[63]Oh, a doctor? 
[64]
[65]So, this is Hollywood? Lights, camera, action, Jay and Silent Bob. 
[66]
[67]Oh my God-- Um--sorry. That was supposed to be a warning shot. Uh--it looks like I'm on the wrong, uh--wrong set. 
[68]The C.L.I.T. stops here, Jay and Silent Bob! Everyone stay calm. I'm a Federal Wildlife Marshal. These men are the leaders of a terrorist organization wanted for the abduction of a monkey. 
[69]No--the clit's real. The female orgasm is a myth. 
[70]
[71]
[72]Hello? Truce? I think I killed both of them. 
[73]Oh my God, I'm paralyzed. The monkey shot me in the ass and paralyzed me! Oh the irony! 
[74]Jesus! Tranqued by a little monkey! My friends in the Bureau are never gonna let me live this down! 
[75]They all made it in, but I failed the exam. Why the hell else do you think I became a Federal Wildlife Marshal? 'Cause I'm a joke! 
[76]What kind of deal? 
[77]You'd be willing to do that? 
[78]Wow. There's a lot of love in the room. 
[79]Sorry, Justice. We've gotta go. Hey--stop stealing monkeys. 
[80]Fair enough. 
[81]You know, I don't get out to the movies much. But I'd have to say Bluntman and Chronic was Blunt-tastic! 
[82]Don't make me shoot you, Justice.
dialogues.SISSY:
[1]Who the fuck are these guys? 
[2]I don't know if that's such a great idea. Jussy. 
[3]We're in the middle of suburbia, Chrissy. Let's try to act like it. 
[4]What's wrong with you, Justice? You do remember where we're going, don't you? 
[5]Fine--they can ride with us. But they're so out of here before we get to Boulder. 
[6]This is Brent. He's with us, too. 
[7]We're the Kansas State chapter of S.A.A.C.--Students Against Animal Cruelty. 
[8]Shut up, I'm thinking. 
[9]Why the fuck did you let that little stoner throw Brent our of the van?! 
[10]We needed Brent, Justice! He was our patsy! 
[11]Because I didn't want to blow our cover! 
[12]Don't mind Chrissy. She's just a little too wound for sound. 
[13]Would you two knock it off? We're in the fucking heartland here! Try to blend! 
[14]Enough! We have a very simple gang here, Justice. I'm the brains, Chrissy's the brawn, and Missy's the tech-girl. But lately, I'm having a hard time figuring out what you're doing here. 
[15]Don't change the subject. You know what you have to do now, right? Since you let our patsy slip away, you've gotta convince the little kid and that fat guy to take his place. They've gotta break into Provasik now. 
[16]Uh-huh. You'll do it; or you're out of this gang. Just use the little one's crush to convince him, since he's so fucking in love with you. 
[17]What--am I blind? He wasn't kissing your hand back in the van like he was fucking Lord Byron? 
[18]You're the one that brought the kid in, Jussy. So you've gotta make amends. 
[19]That kid and his quite friend are our only options at this point. Now we got about two hours before we get to Boulder. That gives you plenty of of time to work on him. 
[20]Why the fuck not? 
[21]Who's it going to be, Jussy--him or us? 
[22]Good. They do their part-- And we'll do ours. 
[23]Jay, before you go, could you say something into the camera about the clitoris. 
[24]She's just a little embarrassed. See, Jussy and I are putting together this documentary for our Human Sexuality class, and we need a male perspective on the clitoris. 
[25]Uh--yeah. 
[26]Awesome. Knock 'em dead, Tiger. 
[27]Jussy. C'mon. 
[28]Hey, Lover-girl. You cock-block my authority again, you lose your fucking fronts, you got that? 
[29]Phase One, down. While we're executing Phase Two, you edit that tape and grab a new car. 
[30]Let's suit up. 
[31]They in? 
[32]Time to shine. Let's go. 
[33]Once we're inside, I want complete silence. Missy whipped this up. It counts our decibel level. If it goes into the red--alarm, we're dead. So not even the slightest noise, got it? 
[34]Justice! Move your ass! 
[35]I can't believe it. Months of planning and it's all blown by a fucking fart. 
[36]That was always the plan, Justice! They take the heat off of is long enough until we can get out of town! 
[37]I told you those two were the perfect patsies. Now we lay low for awhile-- just in case--and start planning the next job. 
[38]Would you two get a room? 
[39]Sarah Lawrence girls. Go figure. 
[40]Oh and not yours? You know, I don't get you, Justice. You used to be all about the girl stuff: stealing, boning, blowing shit up. Now you're like this little priss with a conscience. It's really a fucking drag. 
[41]If moping around over some little boy you're crushing on is being grown- up, then pass me my Wonder Woman underoos. 
[42]Awww. Does Jussy-wussy feel all dirty about setting up her boyfriend? Then how about taking a shower? 
[43]This dopey bitch ordered the large plain, but I could go for some hot, thick, Sicilian. 
[44]That bitch!  That fucking, fucking bitch!!! Get dressed. We're going after her. 
[45]Which is more important to you: a fortune in diamonds or busting a nut? 
[46]Chrissy! Now! 
[47]Because she's gonna be one dead bitch. Hi, Jussy. We catch you at a bad time? 
[48]Let's have those diamonds, Jussy. 
[49]Then lover--boy gets one in the brain. 
[50]You really let me down, Justice. Throwing it all away for a little stoner with bad pronunciation. 
[51]Are you kidding me? I taught you all all your moves myself. There's not a style you can bust that I can't defend against. 
[52]Yeah, but I can bury you with my "Crouching Tiger." 
[53]I'll counter with "Dragon Crane." 
[54]Bring it on. 
[55]Your shit is so tired, Justice!
dialogues.HOLDEN:
[1]Well! I have been waiting years to do this. Look at these morose motherfuckers right here. Smells like someone shit in their cereal. Bunngg! 
[2]No, I was just showering your mother's stink off me after I gave her a quick jump and sent her home. But now that you mention it-- Thanks, you know. You could've made the moral of that story you told me a bit more clear. 
[3]So what brings you two dirt merchants to my neck of the woods? 
[4]You heard about that too, Hunh? Well, I've got nothing to do with it. That's Banky's deal. He owns the property now. I signed my half of the Bluntman and Chronic right over to him years ago. 
[5]Because I'm almost thirty, for God's sake--why on earth would I want to keep writing about characters whose central preoccupations are weed and dick and fart jokes? You gotta grow, man. Don't you ever want more for yourself? I know this poor, hapless sonovabitch does. I look in his doe eyes and I see a man crying out, "When, Lord? When the fuck can your servant ditch this foul-mouthed little chucklehead to whom I am a constant victim of his folly, and who bombards me and those around us with grade-A foolishness that prevents me from even getting to kiss a girl? Fuck! When?! 
[6]When you're right, you're right. I wish I'd broken off a little piece for myself. Because if the buzz is any indication, the movie's gonna make some huge bank. 
[7]The Internet buzz. 
[8]The Internet is a communication device that allows people the world over to bitch about movies and share pornography with one another. Here's what we're looking for: "Movie PoopShoot.com" 
[9]This is a site full of militant movie buffs: sad bastards who live in their parents' basements, downloading scripts and trading what they believe to be inside info about movies and actors they despise yet can't stop discussing. This is where you go if you wanna hear frustrated would-be filmmakers mouth off with their two- bit, arm-chair-director's opinions on how they all could've made a better Episode One. 
[10]Here. This is about the Bluntman movie. "Inside sources tell me Miramax is starting production this Friday on their adaptation of underground comic fave Bluntman and Chronic." 
[11]No, but if it's Miramax, I'm sure it'll be Ben Affleck and Matt Damon. They put'em in a bunch of movies. 
[12]You know--the guys from Good Will Hunting. 
[13]Yeah, I'm not too big a fan either. Though Affleck was the bomb in Phantoms. 
[14]Now down here is where you can gauge the buzz. This is the Shoot Back area. It's where people who read the news get to chime in with their two cents. Here's what a guy who goes by the chick-magnet Net handle of "Wampa- One" thinks about Bluntman and Chronic. "Bluntman and Chronic and their stupid alter egos Jay and Silent Bob only work in small doses, if at all. They don't deserve their own movie." He's got a point. 
[15]"Bluntman and Chronic is the worst comic I ever read. Jay and Silent Bob are stupid characters. A couple of stoners who spout dumb-ass catchphrases like a third-rate Cheech and Chong or Bill and Ted. Fuck Jay and Silent Bob. Fuck them up their stupid asses." 
[16]A guy who calls himself "Magnolia- Fan."  Check out what the guy after him said: "Jay and Silent Bob are terrible, one-note jokes that only stoners laugh at.  They're fucking clown shoes. If they were real, I'd beat the shit out of them for being so stupid. I can't believe Miramax would have anything to so with this shit. I, for one, will be boycotting this movie. Who's with me?" And then there are about fifty more posts from people who agree to join Spartacus-here's boycott of the flick. 
[17]Ah, let it go. Number one, they're a bunch of jealous little dicks who use the anonymity of the Net to insult people who're doing what they wish they were doing, and number two, they're not really talking about you guys--they talking about Bluntman and Chronic. 
[18]Really. 
[19]First off, I don't know how good your names really are. Secondly, there's not much you can do about stopping this bile. The Internet's given everyone in America a voice, and everyone in American has chosen to use that voice to bitch about movies. As long as there's a Bluntman and Chronic movie, the Net-nerds are gonna have something negative to say about it.  Jay steams, thinking. Then, a light dawns on him. 
[20]They're not saying anything about you now--they're talking about fictional characters! 
[21]Yeah, and kiss-off the hundreds of thousands of dollars in royalties you're due in the process. Are you fucking retarded? Look, I'm probably not alone in the opinion that this flick is the worst idea since Greedo shooting first. I mean, a Jay and Silent Bob movie? Who would pay to see that? 
[22]But since it is happening, you might as well just ignore the idiots on the Internet, go find Banky, and get your "motherfucking movie check." As you so succinctly put it. That's what's important here. 
[23]They start this Friday. 
[24]It's more like three days. 
[25]Now that's what I call the Blunt leading the Blunt. 
[26]Nights like this, I miss dating a lesbian.
dialogues.CHRISSY:
[1]Where the fuck did they come from? 
[2]I'm on it. 
[3]And what-stupid ass little foul- mouthed bitch-boys don't get their balls cut off in suburbia? 
[4]Holy shit--he's retarded, to boot. 
[5]"Honest Injun"? I can't believe what a pushover you are. 
[6]Brent, tell these sillies that girls don't fart. 
[7]And we're on our way to Colorado to give Provasik a piece of our minds! 
[8]What the fuck are we gonna do now? 
[9]Nice going, Four Eyes! 
[10]Not as much as I hate you. 
[11]Fuck, if I don't get to kill someone soon, I'm gonna--fucking kill someone! 
[12]Then how about you help me take the edge off? 
[13]Oh, I'm a cow, am I?  I'm a mad cow, bitch. And now I'm gonna rip your head off and fuck your spine stump. 
[14]Shit--your name doesn't even fit the rhyme scheme. 
[15]You're dancing on my last nerve, Strawberry Shortcake. You deal with the weak link. I'm gonna take Missy into the dirty convenience store bathroom and hate- fuck the shit out of her. 
[16]Holy fuck--the little stoner was right-- 
[17]Boom Box! 
[18]Kaboom, you little stoner fucks. 
[19]It's set. Let's roll. 
[20]The only thing I regret is not gutting that little trout-mouthed prick like a fish and playing Twister with his vitals. 
[21]I'll show you nasty, you little slut. 
[22]Fine--we'll take yours. I am gonna stain your sheets, bi- otch. 
[23]Fuck that, I didn't get to cum yet. 
[24]Fuck-- 
[25]Shut the fuck up before I shoot you where you stand in your pansy red booties. 
[26]
dialogues.BANKY:
[1]Uh, Chaka? Yeah, hi--I'm Banky Edwards, the creator of Bluntman and Chronic. We met a few weeks back. I'm the executive producer. 
[2]Banky. I just wanted you to know that I respect your work as an artist. I'm something of an artist myself. I was the inker on the comic book. 
[3]Mister Biggs? Mister Van Der Beek? I just wanted to say hi. I'm-- 
[4]Holy shit! What the fuck are you guys doing here?! 
[5]Stop the movie?! Are you crazy?! 
[6]I feel for you boys--I really do. Those Net snipers can be really cruel. But Miramax paid me a shitload of money for Bluntman and Chronic, so it occurs to me that people bad- mouthing you on some web-site is none of my FUCKING CONCERN! 
[7]So, what do you guys want, to go away and take your lady friends with you? 
[8]Even if there's no movie, people are still free to talk shit about you on the Internet. That's what the Internet's for: slandering others anonymously.  Stopping the flick isn't going to stop that! 
[9]Isn't that your girlfriend's enemy? 
[10]You guys are gonna ruin my movie career. 
[11]Tell you what: we'll settle this monetarily. I'll give you half of what I made. 
[12]Half's not good enough?  Fine--I'll give you two-thirds of what I made! 
[13]Done 
[14]Regardless of what you may have heard. I do not kiss guys. 
[15]Well, boys--you're rich in love-- Well, you're in love. And to top that off, you've got your own monkey. What more could two guys from Jersey possibly want? 
[16]What do I keep telling you? There's not much you can do to stop that. Well, short of showing up at all their houses and beating the shit out of them, I guess. 
[17]I'm so fucking embarrassed-- 
[18]Thanks. That means a lot coming from the guy who pretends to be Shaft as opposed to the guy who takes shaft. 
[19]Hey! Hey! What'd we say? Not in public! 
[20]You--!
dialogues.RANDAL:
[1]What'd I tell you two about dealing in front of the store? Drop the kid and peddle your wares someplace else, burn-boy. And for the record, The Time sucked ass. 
[2]Hey, can't we do something about those two stoners hanging around outside all the time? 
[3]I'm trying to watch Clash of the Titans, and all I can hear is the two them screaming about Morris Day at the top of their lungs. 
[4]What, am I producing an A&E Biography about 'em? I'm just saying they shouldn't be loitering around the stores like they do. 
[5]See, man--if you were funnier than that, ABC never would've canceled us. 
[6]Nothing. 
[7]What service? 
[8]What the hell are you talking about? 
[9]Well if we were gay, that's how I'd see it. 
[10]That does it. I'm gonna do something about those two. I shoulda done a long time ago 
[11]Yeah, I want to report a couple of drug dealers out in front of the Quick Stop. 
[12]I told you that restraining order was a good idea. 
[13]Now that was worse then Clash of the Titans. 
[14]Hey--remind me to renew that restraining order. 
[15]Because I'm gonna blast the flick on the Internet tonight.

[1]You gotta induce the drivers a little.

dialogues.CHAKA:
[1]An inker? What, like you trace? 
[2]I don't see 'em. Where are they? 
[3]Look at this shit. A gay hood ornament, and the color Purple. 
[4]Who the fuck am I? I'm the fucking director, is who I am. Chaka Luther King. The creator of all of this. 
[5]And I'm stealing it. I'm taking it back for all the shit you people have stolen from us! Did you know, I came up with the idea for Sesame Street before PBS? I was going to call it N.W.P.--Niggaz with Puppets. Alright--enough small talk. Let's shoot it.

You make up some shit, fight him for a while, I film it, I yell "cut," and then head back to my trailer, where I got more white women waiting for me there than the first lifeboat off the Titanic! They all want a part of the movie, and I got just the part for 'em.

[5]The money from the movie, dumb-ass. 
[6]boarded issue down from the wall  
[7]Goddamit, man-- Here's the pulse, alright. And here's your finger-- --far from the pulse, jammed straight up your ass. Say--would you like a chocolate covered pretzel? 
[8]You see, kids, if you read Wizard, you'd know it's the top story this month.  Check it out. 
[9]Well, after X-Men hit at the box office, all the studios started buying up every comic property they could get their hands on. Miramax optioned Bluntman and Chronic. 
[10]Yeah, well once they made She's All That, everything went to hell. So you're saying you haven't gotten a cut of the movie? Didn't Holden McNeil and Banky Edwards used to pay you likeness rights for the comic book? 
[11]Well boys, I'm no lawyer, but I think Holden and Banky owe you some of the proverbial phat cash. I mean they're making a movie based on characters that are based on you and Quiet Robert. 
[12]I believe it "Snootchie Boochies." Regardless--you're getting screwed. If I was you guys, I'd confront Holden McNeil and ask him for my movie check. 
[13]And on that note, we cue the music.
dialogues.JAMES:
[1]Holy shit--that looked like it hurt. 
[2]Let's get you guys on your feet. 
[3]Well, you put your dick in a pie, dude-- 
[4]It's James, actually. James Van Der Beek. 
[5]I know, Because what--is Josh better looking than me? Fuck, no. I mean, who on earth is better looking that me? I ask you. 
[6]Well, there was this one time-- Wait a second--who are you guys?! 
[7]The movie we start shooting in a few minutes--Bluntman and Chronic Strike Back. 
[8]Bob 
[9]Jay! Shit, did you even read the script? 
[10]What's gay about it? It's two guys talking in a corner. Man--why are you such a homophobe. 
[11]You are. You're always calling things gay. "Ooo--look at the gay huddle, dude!" 
[12]Next you're going to tell me the monkey's gay. 
[13]
dialogues.NUN:
[1]You two boys need a ride? 
[2]You both don't have to sit back there. One of you can sit up here with me. 
[3]So where are you boys from? 
[4]What brings you to Indiana? 
[5]Hollywood, hunh? That's a long ways away. 
[6]Well, do unto others. That's what the Book says. 
[7]I live my life by it. 
[8]Of course. You know how lonely it gets on the road? Thanks to the Book, I'm never alone--if you know what I mean. 
[9]Are you kidding? I've dedicated my life to it. Every hour of every day. 
[10]You live by the Book, too? 
[11]That's good to hear. But it takes deed, not words. It's a lot easier to say you live by the Book than to actually do it. Can you do it? 
[12]No time like the present, right?
dialogues.JASON:
[1]Are you guys alright? Hey! They've got a monkey! 
[2]Enough! Jason Biggs. 
[3]You mean Shannon? Sadly, no. 
[4]They're our stunt doubles, dumbass. Right? 
[5]You're doubling me. I'm playing Bluntman, AKA Silent Bill. 
[6]Right. And he's playing Chronic. AKA Ray. 
[7]There's a script? 
[8]What's with the weird, gay huddle going on over there? 
[9]I'm not a homophobe. 
[10]Hey--look at the monkey. 
[11]He's so cute-- C'mere. Monkey. C'mere-- 
[12]
dialogues.BRENT:
[1]Say--what's all this talk about farting? 
[2]Of course they don't! Only skeevy stoners fart. 
[3]What up, homies? Wow, Three guys, four girls-- What's the count boys? 
[4]Hey there mister science-guy. Don't spray that aerosol in my eye. For I don't really want to die. I'm a noble rabbit! 
[5]Hey! Watch the language little boy. There are females present. 
[6]No--more like rabbits, dogs, cats... heck, even monkeys, If we don't speak for them, who will? Right, Jussy? 
[7]I'm down with this because I love animals, stupid. 
[8]Of course. Sheep are beautiful creatures. 
[9]Oh God, yes. 
[10]What is your damage little boy? You've got a sick and twisted world perspective. 
[11]I--suppose so.
dialogues.SECURITY GUARD:
[1]Where do you think you're going? 
[2]This is L.A., sir. We don't rape our suspects in custody. We just beat them. Echo Base, I've got a ten-o-seven here: two unauthorizeds on the lot. Request back-up. 
[3]No, sir--a ten-eight-two is the code for vanishing a dead hooker from Ben Affleck's trailer. 
[4]Contrary to what you believe, not everyone in the movie business is gay. 
[5]Alright. But make is fast. And sexy. 
[6]Sorry to interrupt, sirs, but have a ten-oh-seven on our hands. 
[7]
[8]Do they have you hostage? Should we call your publicists? 
[9]Great work, sirs! If you let us in, we'll take over-- 
[10]Uh--okay. We'll just be--outside the door, sirs. 
[11]He'll be the pie--in prison.
dialogues.MOTHER:
[1]Bobby-Boy stay here while mommy picks up the free cheese, 'kay? 
[2]This'll keep the sun out of your eyes. You be good now. 
[3]Don't fucking move, you little shit- machine. Mommy's gonna try to score. 
[4]The fat one's watching the little one. 
[5]
[6]D'jou hear the crazy fuck tellin' me how to fuckin' raise you? Motherfucker, man! Who's he fucking think he is? What's the worse fuckin' thing could happen to you sitting outside the fuckin' stores? Fuck! 
[7]Can I help you? 
[8]Yes. He's my son. 
[9]One moment.
dialogues.TEEN 1:
[1]Lemme get a nickel bag. 
[2]What the hell are you singing? 
[3]Purple Rain. 
[4]Two packs of Wraps. Yo--how was the service? 
[5]Jay said you had a Star-Wars--themed wedding and you guys tied the knot dressed like storm troopers. 
[6]Holy shit, dude. The honeymoon's over. 
[7]Well, sure. Not in the eyes of the state or any real church, Skywalker. 
[8]May the Foreskin be with you. Hand Jabba the Hutt. 
[9]Here're the rolling papers you wanted for your pot. And your change. Thanks. And The Time sucks ass!
dialogues.DANTE:
[1]Why? What'd they do now? 
[2]I thought the fat one didn't really talk much. 
[3]Neither should you, but we let you stay. 
[4]What? 
[5]I'm the bitch?! 
[6]Would you shut up?! 
[7]We're not married to each other. 
[8]I still can't believe Judy Dench played me. 
[9]Why?
dialogues.ANCHORMAN:
[1]I'm Reg Hartner and this is a News Now bulletin. A Provasik animal testing facility in boulder was the focus of an attack by a terroristic primate rescue syndicate calling themselves the Coalition for Liberation of Itinerant Tree-Dwellers. Or simply, C.L.I.T. 
[2]In a videotape sent to authorities this morning, credit for the liberation of an orangutan from the lab last night is taken by these men-- 
[3]--identified in literature that accompanies the tape as Jay and Silent Bob. In this chilling clip, they make it very clear that they are in control of the C.L.I.T. 
[4]Terrifying. Here to help us understand this footage is Federal Wildlife Marshal Willenholly. 
[5]Marshal, what can you tell us about the C.L.I.T.? 
[6]The Liberate Apes Before Imprisoning Apes movement. 
[7]Marshal, how do you respond to allegations that Federal Wildlife Marshal's Office allowed the C.L.I.T. to slip through their fingers? 
[8]Is there also speculation that Jay and Silent bob may be responsible for the Diamond Exchange jewel heist that occurred in the same vicinity of downtown Boulder last night? 
[9]Is that your cell phone?
dialogues.AGENT SID:
[1]Holy shit! Yeah, put him through. 
[2]Willenholly? 
[3]I'll bet, Will. What's it this time... Beaver trouble? Some kind of unauthorized marsupial trafficking? 
[4]No way, man. It's just me and you talking here. 
[5]Los Angeles, hunh? Maybe we should stake out Clint Eastwood's place. Didn't he used to drive around with a monkey that'd punch people and drink beer? 
[6]No way--Dunston! 
[7]Calm down, Will. Don't go all... bananas on us! 
[8]You're right, Will. Tell you what-- we'll get our best man on your case right away. You might've heard of him. He's a doctor. 
[9]His name's Doctor Zaius!
dialogues.BEN:
[1]Where are we taking it from, Gus? 
[2]You're a true artist, Gus 
[3]Oh, now you're the director. 
[4]I'm sorry this is taking you away from whatever-gay-killers-on-horses- who-like-to-play-golf-touchy-feely- flick you're supposed to be doing this week. 
[5]You're like a child. What've I been telling you? Sometimes you've gotta do the safe picture. Sometimes, you do it for art. Sometimes, it's the payback picture your friend says you owe him-- 
[6]And sometimes, you go back to the well. 
[7]Now that's just mean. 
[8]Action, Gus? 
[9]Wait a second! I wasn't with any hookers today!
dialogues.MISSY:

[2]That we do have a job to do? 
[3]Smooth move, Justice. 
[4]No sweat. 
[5]You can say that. 
[6]You are so nasty. 
[7]You should've just let these guys go down, Jussy. 
[8]

[6]You in this town and you gonna ask that question? Be a little more specific. 
[7]I don't know that the fuck you just said, little kid. But you touched a brother's heart, so I'm gonna help you out with some directions to the studio. 
[8]Fuck, yes. Miramax accounts for seventy-eight percent of my business.
